channel.title: maria sholola on Cooperstone Lab
channel.description: Recent content in maria sholola on Cooperstone Lab

item.title: Phytochemical analysis
item.description: In order to understand what phytochemicals are doing within a system, robust and quantitative methods are required for their analysis. We focus on developing liquid chromatography and mass spectrometry based methods to allow analysis of phytochemicals and their metabolites, often present at picomolar concentrations. Some papers here are also included which use our methods. Here is some work we’ve published on the topic: Fenstemaker S, Sim L, Cooperstone JL, Francis DM.

item.title: Nutrition interventions with fruits and vegetables
item.description: To determine the in vivo health impacts of fruits and vegetables and their constituent phytochemicals, we conduct studies in animals and humans. We look to understand absorption, metabolism, distribution, excretion, and effect on development of disease. Here is some work we’ve published on the topic: In humans: Thomas M, Puglisi M, Malysheva O, Caudill M, Sholola MJ, Cooperstone JL, Fernandez ML. Eggs improve plasma biomarkers in patients with metabolic syndrome following a plant-based diet.
